title: Did you know?
body: Quolls are nocturnal animals (active during night).

title: Wow!
body: Quolls can consume both animals and plants. Their diet is mainly based on small mammals, birds, snakes, and insects.

title: Cute little buggers
body: Of the six species of quoll, four live in Australia and two are from New Guinea.

title: Definitely not a cat
body: "They're known as the native cat, due to their cat-like appearance."

title: I think they're more like bulky mice
body: The quoll is an apex predator, as they are one of the largest species of carnivorous marsupials in the world.

title: I'm frightened of them now.
body: I've never gone from "Awww" to "Ahhhh!" as quickly as that.
